problem: John decides to run 4 sprints 2 times a week.  He runs 87 meters each sprint.  How many total meters does he run a week?
solution:
He sprints 4*2=<<4*2=8>>8 times
So he runs 8*87=<<8*87=696>>696 meters
#### 696

Lara, Lucia, Natasha, Samantha wants to buy a $715.00 pair of shoes and a matching belt that is $25.00.  Her part-time job pays her $5.00 an hour.  How many hours will she have to work before she can make her purchase?
solution:
She wants to buy a pair of shoes for $715.00 and a belt for $25.00 for a total of 715+25 = $<<715+25=740>>740.00
Her purchase will total $740.00 and she makes $5.00 at her part-time job so she'll have to work 740/5 = <<740/5=148>>148 hours
#### 148

problem: A soccer team has 154 members.  There are twice as many players on the offense as there is on the defense. There is half the number of players on the special teams as there is on the defense.  How many players are on the defense?
solution:
Let x represent the number of players on the defense
Offense:2x
Special Teams:(1/2)x
Total:x+2x+(1/2)x=154
(7/2)x=154
x=154(2/7)=44 players
#### 44

problem: Jack injured his back and needs to go to physical therapy.  He went to physical therapy for 11 weeks.  Each week he went twice for 3 hours at a time.  If the sessions cost $457 per hour how much did the physical therapy cost?
solution:
Each week he did 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours of physical therapy
So it cost 6*457=$<<6*457=2742>>2742 per week
This means he spent 2742*11=$<<2742*11=30162>>30162

problem: Jamie, Jethro, Joseph, Jesus saw 28 birds in their backyard and threw a stone at them, scaring away 1/4 of that number. A few minutes later, 86 more birds joined the fearless birds. How many birds are now in the backyard?
solution:
The total number of birds scared away after he threw the stone at them is 1/4 * 28 = <<1/4*28=7>>7 birds.
The total number of birds remaining is 28 - 7 = <<28-7=21>>21 birds.
If 86 more birds joined, the total number of birds in the backyard will become 21 + 86 = <<21+86=107>>107 birds.
#### 107

problem: My niece went to a gardening shop. She bought a set of pots for $68 and a sack of garden soil for $41. At checkout, she used a coupon for $94 off. How much money did my niece spend at the gardening shop?

problem: From her science class study, Anna learned that each whale in the sea has 94 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*94 = <<3*94=282>>282 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*282 = <<10*282=2820>>2820 gallons of blood.
#### 2820

10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*69 = <<10*69=690>>690 gallons of blood.
#### 690

problem: From her science class study, Maja learned that each whale in the sea has 57 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. Calculate the number of gallons of blood that ten sharks swimming in the sea have.
solution:
Since a shark has three times as much blood as a whale, then a shark has 3*57 = <<3*57=171>>171 gallons of blood.
10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*171 = <<10*171=1710>>1710 gallons of blood.
#### 1710

10 sharks swimming in the sea will have 10*213 = <<10*213=2130>>2130 gallons of blood.
